subtitle: When to worry about belly pains
description: When to worry about belly pains
title: I have pain in my belly
content:
Created by BabyCenter

Aches, pains and cramps in your stomach while you are pregnant are normal. They are usually nothing to worry about. Your body is changing to support your growing baby, and your womb is stretching to fit the baby as he grows.

Getting some rest usually eases the cramps. Try to relax. Sit down for a while with your feet up, or lie down on the side opposite to where you feel the pain.

Sometimes stomach pain can mean something is wrong:

•	Stomach cramps, bleeding and pain in the centre of the lower abdomen in early pregnancy could mean that you are losing your baby. Go to the health facility if you feel like this. If the bleeding is heavy and you are soaking more than 1 pad an hour, you need to rush to the health facility. 

•	Painful cramps that start on one side and spread across your tummy may mean that your pregnancy is growing in the wrong place. You may also have bleeding that is dark and watery. This happens in early pregnancy. Go to the health facility immediately.

•	In later pregnancy, if you have pain in your lower abdomen, along with backache, stomach cramps and diarrhoea, it may mean that your baby is trying to be born early. Go to the health facility if you have frequent pains in late pregnancy, if you have bleeding or your waters break.
